thread.title: Blinking Cursor Devours CPU Cycles in Visual Studio Code Editor
thread.title_full: Blinking Cursor Devours CPU Cycles in Visual Studio Code Editor

author: msmash
title: Blinking Cursor Devours CPU Cycles in Visual Studio Code Editor
text: on Friday March 24, 2017 @02:01PM from the behind-the-scene dept. An anonymous reader shares a report on The Register: Microsoft describes Visual Studio Code as a source code editor that's "optimized for building and debugging modern web and cloud applications." In fact, VSC turns out to be rather inefficient when it comes to CPU resources. Developer Jo Liss has found that the software, when in focus and idle, uses 13 percent of CPU capacity just to render its blinking cursor . Liss explains that the issue can be reproduced by closing all VSC windows, opening a new window, opening a new tab with an empty untitled file, then checking CPU activity. For other macOS applications that present a blinking cursor, like Chrome or TextEdit, Liss said, the CPU usage isn't nearly as excessive. The issue is a consequence of rendering the cursor every 16.67ms (60 fps) rather than every 500ms.
